explains: adj. 中期的；学期中间的

sentences.en: She was about to walk into a midterm exam for a subject she knew very little about.
sentences.cn: 她马上就要参加一个她知之甚少的科目的期中考试了。

sentences.en: Bush's Republican Party faces a tough challenge in midterm congressional elections in November.
sentences.cn: 布什的共和党在11月中期国会选举中面临艰难的挑战。

sentences.en: In fact, I was still rewriting my midterm the morning it was due.
sentences.cn: 事实上，直到期中考试快要结束的那天早上，我还在重写卷子。
